"Vasco": "Thank you very much once again for your hard work."
"Even I am not entirely sure what those things are..."
"One hypothesis is that those floating objects serve as some form of environmental control."
"That would explain why the climate changes so drastically between regions."
"Also why they are lined up in between regions in the fashion that they are..."
"I think we should consider that those two points are related to each other."
"Well, again, it's just a hypothesis, and we won't know until I examine the data more closely."
"Anyways, once again you've provided me with invaluable data."
"Thank you very much. If something else comes up, I hope I can count on you."
"In this world, within various places there are lurking secrets. There is inherent value in solving these mysteries."
"Not to mention, if I can solve even one of these mysteries, my life's work will be given meaning."
"Ah, hello. Have your missions been proceeding smoothly?"
"Indeed, the scope of my own activities has increased, and I've been conducting ever more thorough investigations."
"Alas, as everyone is busy, I lack the data I so dearly desire."
"What say you to lending your aid on my behalf once again?"
"Oh, all I require is data, so please do keep whatever ores you obtain."
"I'll transmit details regarding the location of Snowks to your Mag. With that, I bid you the best of luck!"
"Of course, I understand that you're busy too. Let me ask you at a more opportune time, then."
"Excellent work. Thanks for providing such great data once again."
"Without further ado, I'll start scanning right away."
"I must say, investigating heretofore unexplored areas is quite the thrill!"
"Indeed, exploration of such unknown locales is why I applied to be a part of this vanguard."
"There's an entire world outside of Aelio, and I can't describe how wonderful it to examine it all."
"Ah, my apologies... Rambling on about myself like that."
"I'm just really happy to be where I am in life. Not only am I doing what I love, but it has real meaning to it."
"I never would have gotten to do this research without your assistance, nor without the support of my wonderful colleagues."
"Once again, I just want to thank you. I hope we can work together again soon."
"What great timing! Listen, I have another request for you."
"This discovery could be huge. Please!"
"If my guess is correct, then..."
"Well anyways, I'll be waiting. Be careful out there."
"Ah... I understand. Another time, then."
"Thank you kindly. And thanks again for the data thus far."
"Even at your Mag's maximum level of zoom, it's quite blurry, but it's much clearer than if we tried looking at it from down here."
"Perhaps there are less impurities in the air than in Aelio or Retem."
"Using your data, I examined what materials the Floating Island's exterior could be made of..."
"As I expected, it seems to be made from similar materials as those strange floating objects that line the perimeters of the regions."
"Somewhat similar to Trainia, but far more resilient to weathering. Extremely durable materials."
"I had previously hypothesized that those floating objects were controlling the environments of Halpha."
"What if, perhaps, the Floating Island serves as the environmental controller, and the floating objects were simply a means of extending its influence...?"
"...Hahaha. Perhaps I'm simply jumping to conclusions."
"Still, new discoveries are often made by relating two small pieces of information together like that."
"Indeed, it has undoubtedly become the overarching theme of this research."
"I intend to continue my research into the mysteries of Halpha. Thank you very much for your cooperation."
"Thanks to you, I now know what avenues I should be taking going forward."
"I intend to continue my research into the mysteries of Halpha."
